metadata.title: Makcu Official
metadata.description: Experience seamless mouse and keyboard control with MAKCU, the next generation.

home.main_header: Experience security and speed with the next generation.
home.name: Makcu

list.title: Server members
list.description: We have a large number of active users and a strong technical team built by an excellent user community.

list.title: Supported Mice
list.description: We are actively adapting to all mice and believe that 100% coverage will be achieved soon.

tools.title: Firmware Flashing
tools.description: Flash firmware to your MAKCU device. Follow the steps carefully to ensure successful flashing.
tools.connectToSelect: Connect your device to enable selection
tools.browserNotSupported: Your browser does not support Web Serial/WebUSB. Please use Chrome, Edge, or another Chromium-based browser.
tools.driverNotice: If you have not installed the CH343 driver yet then please click

steps.title: Flashing Steps
steps.description: Follow these steps carefully to flash your MAKCU device.
steps.step1: Hold the button closest to the side you want to flash (left button for USB 1/left side, right button for USB 3/right side)
steps.step2: Connect the USB cable to the corresponding port (USB 1 for left, USB 3 for right)
steps.step3: Listen for the USB connection sound on your PC
steps.step4: Release the button after you hear the sound
steps.step5: Click the Connect button at the top right of the page
steps.step6: Select the firmware from the dropdown that matches the side you're flashing (check the numbers on the MAKCU board to match USB 1/3 with left/right)
steps.step7: Wait for the flashing process to complete
steps.step8: When told to disconnect, remove the USB cable and repeat the process for the other side

flashing_tool.title: Flashing Tool
flashing_tool.description: Use the tool below to flash firmware to your MAKCU device.

firmware_selection.title: Firmware Selection
firmware_selection.description: Select the appropriate firmware for the side you are flashing.
firmware_selection.left_note: USB 1 corresponds to the left side - select firmware with 'LEFT' in the name
firmware_selection.right_note: USB 3 corresponds to the right side - select firmware with 'RIGHT' in the name
firmware_selection.matching_note: Check the numbers printed on the MAKCU board to ensure you match the correct USB port to the correct side

not_found.sub_text: Oops! The page you're looking for doesn't exist.

error.sub_text: We're sorry, but an error occurred while processing your request.

troubleshooting.title: MAKCU Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: LED status guide and troubleshooting steps for MAKCU device issues.

connection_status.title: Connection Status
connection_status.description: The MAKCU connection status is displayed in the top right of the navbar, next to the audio toggle. The status shows the current connection state and mode of your MAKCU device.

not_supported.label: Not Supported
not_supported.description: Your browser does not support Web Serial API. Please use Chrome/Edge 89+, Opera 76+, or another Chromium-based browser.

disconnected.label: Disconnected
disconnected.description: MAKCU is not connected. Click the Connect button to establish a connection.

connecting.label: Connecting...
connecting.description: The system is attempting to connect to MAKCU and detect which mode it is in (normal or flash mode).

normal_mode.label: Normal mode
normal_mode.description: MAKCU is connected and running in normal mode. You can use the settings page to configure and test MAKCU. USB 1 is connected to gaming PC, USB 2 is the COM port, USB 3 should be connected to either your mouse or keyboard. **3.9 fw only supports keyboard.

flash_mode.label: Flash mode
flash_mode.description: MAKCU is connected in flash mode. This mode is used for firmware updates only. Settings cannot be used in this mode. Only one USB cable should be connected (USB 1 or USB 3).

fault.label: Fault
fault.description: Connection failed or device is not responding. Check your USB connections and try again. Swapping USB ports and refreshing the page may help.

connection_status.com_port_note: Note: The COM port number is not displayed as it is not available via the Web Serial API for security reasons. The connection status will show the mode (normal or flash) instead.

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.ch343_desc: MAKCU requires the CH343 USB-to-serial driver to be loaded on your computer. Please see the flash page for the download link and installation instructions.
prerequisites.com_port_desc: The COM port for USB 2 should be below 10. If your COM port number is 10 or higher, you may experience connection issues.
prerequisites.both_sides_desc: Make sure you have correctly set up and flashed MAKCU on both the left side (device) and right side (host).
prerequisites.supported_device_desc: Ensure you have a supported mouse or keyboard connected. MAKCU supports both keyboard and mouse devices.

led_guide.title: LED Status Guide
led_guide.description: MAKCU uses LEDs on both sides to indicate system status and help you troubleshoot issues. The LEDs can be solid (on or off) or blinking at different speeds.

left_side.title: Left Side (Device Side)
left_side.description: The left side LED shows the status of the USB device connection to your computer.

solid_on.title: Solid ON (Green)
solid_on.meaning: USB device is connected and working correctly
solid_on.action: No action needed - everything is working

solid_off.title: Solid OFF
solid_off.action: Check USB cable connection and ensure device is powered on

slow_blink.title: Slow Blink (500ms on, 500ms off)
slow_blink.when: Baud rate is being changed or system is reconfiguring
slow_blink.action: Wait a few seconds - this should resolve automatically. If it persists, try restarting MAKCU.

fast_blink.title: Fast Blink (100ms on, 100ms off)
fast_blink.when: USB host (right side) has stopped responding, bridge connection between left and right sides is broken, or host crash/timeout detected
fast_blink.action: Check the connection between left and right sides, check the right side LED status, try unplugging and reconnecting both USB cables, or reflash both sides if problem persists

right_side.title: Right Side (Host Side)
right_side.description: The right side LED shows the status of the USB host connection to your mouse/keyboard.

solid_on.title: Solid ON (Green)
solid_on.meaning: USB host is connected and working correctly
solid_on.action: No action needed - everything is working

solid_off.title: Solid OFF
solid_off.meaning: No USB device connected to host
solid_off.action: Connect a supported mouse or keyboard to the right side USB port

slow_blink.title: Slow Blink (500ms on, 500ms off)
slow_blink.when: USB request is busy (normal during operation) or system is handling a temporary condition
slow_blink.action: Usually resolves automatically. If it persists, check device connection.

fast_blink.title: Fast Blink (100ms on, 100ms off)
fast_blink.when: USB device (left side) has stopped responding, bridge connection between left and right sides is broken, timer or USB request failures, or device crash/timeout detected
fast_blink.action: Check the connection between left and right sides, check the left side LED status, try unplugging and reconnecting both USB cables, or reflash both sides if problem persists

both_fast.title: Both LEDs Fast Blinking
both_fast.problem: Both left and right sides show fast blink (error state)
both_fast.causes: Bridge connection between sides is broken, UART communication failure, or one side has crashed or reset
both_fast.steps: Power cycle both sides (unplug and replug USB cables), check physical connections between left and right sides, verify both sides are powered correctly, or reflash both sides if problem persists

left_fast.title: Left Side Fast Blink, Right Side Normal
left_fast.problem: Left side shows error, right side is working
left_fast.causes: Right side (host) has crashed or stopped responding, or bridge heartbeat timeout on left side
left_fast.steps: Check right side LED - if it's also showing error, see 'Both LEDs Fast Blinking', try restarting the right side, or reflash the right side if needed

right_fast.title: Right Side Fast Blink, Left Side Normal
right_fast.problem: Right side shows error, left side is working
right_fast.causes: Left side (device) has crashed or stopped responding, or bridge heartbeat timeout on right side
right_fast.steps: Check left side LED - if it's also showing error, see 'Both LEDs Fast Blinking', try restarting the left side, or reflash the left side if needed

slow_persists.title: Slow Blink Persists
slow_persists.problem: LED keeps blinking slowly and doesn't resolve
slow_persists.causes: System stuck in configuration state, baud rate change didn't complete, or warning condition not clearing
slow_persists.steps: Wait 10 seconds - some operations take time, power cycle the affected side, check for any error messages in device manager, or reflash if problem continues

led_not_responding.title: LED Not Responding
led_not_responding.problem: LED doesn't turn on or change state at all
led_not_responding.causes: LED hardware issue, firmware not running, or power issue
led_not_responding.steps: Verify device is powered (check USB connection), check if device is recognized in device manager, try reflashing the firmware, or if still not working, there may be a hardware issue

device_not_working.title: Device Not Working Despite Green LED
device_not_working.problem: LED shows solid ON (green) but mouse/keyboard doesn't work
device_not_working.causes: Device driver issue on computer, USB port problem, or device compatibility issue
device_not_working.steps: Check device manager for any error icons, try a different USB port, verify CH343 driver is installed correctly, check if COM port number is below 10, or try a different mouse or keyboard to test

baud_rate_mismatch.title: Baud Rate Mismatch / Cheat Not Connecting
baud_rate_mismatch.problem: MAKCU is not changing baud rate or cheat is not connecting to MAKCU.
symptoms: Cheat software cannot communicate with MAKCU
Device appears connected but no data exchange
baud_rate_mismatch.solution: Open device manager and change the com port to be any number below 10 (you may force a com port number if all are in use). Ensure baud rate is matched to the cheat's expectations. The MAKCU.com website and the AIO tool expect MAKCU to be running at 115200 (1 flash mode). Users must ensure that baud rate 115200 is enabled to communicate with the website and tools.
steps: Check the baud rate indicator LED (left) when MAKCU starts - it should flash 1 time for 115200
If baud rate is incorrect, press the left button 4 times fast to change it
Ensure USB 1 + USB 2 are connected for MAKCU to have power to change baud rate
Change COM port in your cheat software settings to match MAKCU's
Verify baud rate matches between MAKCU and your cheat software
If using MAKCU website or AIO tool, ensure baud rate is set to 115200
baud_rate_mismatch.important: USB 1 + USB 2 must be connected for MAKCU to take power. USB 2 does not provide power to MAKCU - this prevents back feeding to the main PC and 2nd PC from both USB ports.

still_issues.title: Still Having Issues?
still_issues.description: If you've tried all troubleshooting steps and the problem persists:
still_issues.verify_setup_desc: Ensure both sides are correctly flashed and configured
still_issues.check_connections_desc: Verify all USB cables and connections are secure
still_issues.driver_check_desc: Confirm CH343 driver is installed and COM port is below 10
still_issues.supported_device_desc: Ensure you're using a supported mouse or keyboard
still_issues.reflash_desc: Try reflashing both sides with the latest firmware
still_issues.hardware_check_desc: If LEDs don't respond at all, there may be a hardware issue
still_issues.remember: Remember: MAKCU supports both keyboard and mouse devices. However, not all mice and keyboards are compatible with MAKCU. If your mouse is not functional, please try another mouse.

flash_vs_normal_mode.title: Flash Mode vs Normal Mode
flash_vs_normal_mode.description: Understanding how MAKCU works with its 2 chips and 3 USB ports.

makcu_structure.title: MAKCU Structure
makcu_structure.content: MAKCU has 2 chips and 3 USB ports. USB port 1 and USB port 3 are connected to the 2 chips. USB port 2 is the COM port used to send commands to MAKCU while in normal use mode.

flash_mode.title: Flash Mode
flash_mode.description: Flash mode is used only when updating the firmware on MAKCU.

steps.1: Hold down the button closest to MAKCU (left chip = left button, right chip = right button)
steps.2: Connect the USB cable to the corresponding USB port (USB 1 for left chip, USB 3 for right chip)
steps.3: Once you hear the USB connection sound on your PC, release the button
steps.4: The device will now appear on your PC in flash mode

flash_mode.important: If the button is NOT held down when the cable is connected, the device will NOT show up on your PC.
flash_mode.cable_note: In flash mode, you should only use ONE cable to perform flashing. Do not connect multiple USB cables at the same time.

normal_mode.title: Normal Mode
normal_mode.description: This is how MAKCU is used during normal operation.

connections.usb1: USB 1 → Connected to your gaming PC
connections.usb2: USB 2 → COM port (used for sending commands to MAKCU)

normal_mode.important: In normal mode, MAKCU can be tested and adjusted. You do NOT need to flash USB 2, and you do NOT hold any buttons down to use normal mode.

power_requirements.title: Power Requirements
power_requirements.description: Understanding how MAKCU receives power is critical for proper operation.
power_requirements.normal_mode: In normal mode, USB 1 + USB 2 must be connected to power MAKCU. USB 2 does not provide power to MAKCU - this is done to ensure there is no back feeding to the main PC and the 2nd PC from both USB ports.
power_requirements.flash_mode: Flash mode uses 1 cable at a time. Only connect USB 1 OR USB 3, not both simultaneously.
power_requirements.warning: Failing to follow these power requirements will lead to incorrect usage, MAKCU showing signs of not being functional, and being unable to flash. These broken symptoms are due to not understanding the power requirements.

flash_vs_normal_mode.problem: Cannot use settings when device is in flash mode, or cannot flash when device is in normal mode.
flash_vs_normal_mode.solution: To enter flash mode: Hold the button, connect USB cable, wait for USB sound, then release button. To use normal mode: Connect USB 1 to gaming PC, USB 2 for COM port, and USB 3 to mouse - no buttons need to be held.

settings.title: MAKCU Settings
settings.description: Configure and interact with your MAKCU device via WebSerial connection.

status.connected_flash: Connected in Flash mode (settings cannot be used in this mode)

connection.title: Connection
connection.browser_not_supported: Your browser does not support Web Serial API. Please use Chrome/Edge 89+, Opera 76+, or another Chromium-based browser.

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.firmware_desc: The settings page requires firmware version 3.9 or later
prerequisites.usb1: USB 1 connected to your gaming PC
prerequisites.usb1_desc: USB 1 must be connected to your gaming PC
prerequisites.usb2_desc: USB 2 must be connected to the same computer. Otherwise, MAKCU is not functional.
prerequisites.note: Note: If you encounter connection issues, please see the troubleshooting page for detailed setup instructions.

warnings.flash_mode_detected: Flash mode detected. Settings cannot be used in this mode.
warnings.normal_mode_detected: Normal mode detected. Flashing must be completed on USB 1 or 3 only. Please remove all cables to set MAKCU into flash mode.

baud_rate.title: Baud Rate
baud_rate.description: Ensure makcu is configured with 115200 baud rate to use the settings, otherwise makcu will fail to function
baud_rate.warning: Baud rate change is PERMANENT and should only be set if your cheat has told you to use a different baud rate. A mismatched baud rate will stop your cheat from communicating with MAKCU.
baud_rate.how_to_change: Press the left button on MAKCU 4 times fast to change the baud rate from 115200 to 4mbps. The LED will flash 1 or 4 times and the baud rate will be saved.
baud_rate.led_indicator: When MAKCU starts, the baud rate indicator LED (left) will show what speed MAKCU is running at.
baud_rate.startup_indicator: When MAKCU starts, the baud rate indicator LED (left) will flash to indicate the current baud rate: 1 flash = 115200, 4 flashes = 4mbps.
baud_rate.website_requirement: The MAKCU website expects to use 115200 baud rate. Ensure if you are trying to use normal mode with the MAKCU website, you set the baud rate to 115200.
baud_rate.setting_methods: The baud rate can be set by the user (using the button method), or by the developer in code.
baud_rate.power_requirement: USB 1 + USB 2 must be connected for MAKCU to take power to change the baud rate. USB 2 does not provide power to MAKCU - this is done to ensure there is no back feeding to the main PC and the 2nd PC from both USB ports.

setup.title: Setup Guide
setup.description: Follow these steps to get your MAKCU device up and running.

install_driver.title: 1. Install CH343 Driver
install_driver.description: Install the CH343 driver on your cheat PC (the computer you will use for flashing).
steps: Download the CH343 driver from the link below
Run the installer on your cheat PC
Follow the installation wizard to complete the setup

flash_makcu.title: 2. Flash MAKCU Firmware
flash_makcu.description: Flash the firmware to your MAKCU device using the firmware flashing page.
flash_makcu.dropdown_explanation: The flash page has a dropdown menu that shows the left and right firmwares. You should match USB1 to the left side and USB3 to the right side of the USB port. Under the MAKCU board, there is text to explain the numbers.

flashing_process.title: How Flashing Works
flashing_process.flash_mode: First, you need to enter flash mode. Hold down the button closest to the side you want to flash (left button for left side/USB1, right button for right side/USB3), then connect the USB cable. Once you hear the USB sound on your PC, release the button.
flashing_process.connecting: After entering flash mode, connect to the device using the connection button at the top right of the page. The system will automatically detect that the device is in flash mode.
flashing_process.selecting_firmware: Select the appropriate firmware from the dropdown menu. Make sure to select the left firmware for USB1 and the right firmware for USB3.
flashing_process.flashing: Click on the firmware in the dropdown to start flashing. The progress will be shown in the log window.
flashing_process.completing: When the flash has completed, remove the USB cable. Then repeat the process with the other side (hold the other button down, connect USB cable, wait for USB sound, release button, connect at top right, and flash).

baud_rate.title: Baud Rate
baud_rate.description: The baud rate is usually 115200. Please refer to the troubleshooting page for information on how to change the baud rate if needed.

power_requirements.title: Power Requirements
power_requirements.description: Understanding how MAKCU receives power is critical for proper operation.
power_requirements.normal_mode: In normal mode, USB 1 + USB 2 must be connected to power MAKCU. USB 2 does not provide power to MAKCU - this is done to ensure there is no back feeding to the main PC and the 2nd PC from both USB ports.
power_requirements.flash_mode: Flash mode uses 1 cable at a time. Only connect USB 1 OR USB 3, not both simultaneously.
power_requirements.warning: Failing to follow these power requirements will lead to incorrect usage, MAKCU showing signs of not being functional, and being unable to flash. These broken symptoms are due to not understanding the power requirements.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.ch343_desc: MAKCU requires the CH343 USB-to-serial driver to be loaded on your cheat computer (the computer you will use for flashing). The driver download link is provided in the section below.
requirements.com_port_desc: The COM port for USB 2 should be below 10. If your COM port number is 10 or higher, you may experience connection issues.
requirements.both_sides_desc: Make sure you have correctly set up and flashed MAKCU on both the left side (device) and right side (host).
requirements.supported_device_desc: Ensure you have a supported mouse or keyboard connected. MAKCU supports both keyboard and mouse devices.

xim.title: XIM Setup Guide
xim.description: Learn how to set up XIM with MAKCU for controller support.

setup.title: How to Setup XIM with MAKCU for Controller

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.mouse_requirement_desc: A working mouse must be used for XIM setup. The mouse must remain connected to USB 3 at all times for MAKCU to function with the aimbot. Removal of the mouse will stop the cheat from working.
prerequisites.makcu_functional_desc: MAKCU should be fully functional and working in normal mouse mode before attempting XIM setup. Ensure MAKCU works correctly with a mouse connected to USB 3.
prerequisites.baud_rate_warning_desc: MAKCU's baud rate must match your cheat's expected speed. Ensure the baud rate is correctly configured before proceeding.
prerequisites.xim_guide_note_desc: Before connecting MAKCU to XIM, ensure you have reviewed XIM setup guides for configuring XIM with a mouse and controller. Refer to official XIM documentation for button and stick mapping.

xim_configuration.title: XIM Configuration
xim_configuration.important_note: Important: This guide is only for using controller with MAKCU.
xim_configuration.xim_must_work: XIM Must Be Fully Functional First
xim_configuration.xim_must_work_desc: Before MAKCU is connected to XIM, the XIM should be fully functional with the game of your choice. Please refer to the XIM setup guides in relation to how to configure the XIM with a mouse and controller, ensuring buttons and sticks are mapped to the mouse before even attempting to connect MAKCU.
xim_configuration.xim_testing_desc: The XIM should be tested with the mouse able to move the right thumb stick in your game and the mouse buttons should function as controller buttons to ensure XIM has been fully setup.

makcu_setup.title: MAKCU Setup Requirements
makcu_setup.mouse_connection_desc: MAKCU expects a mouse to be attached to USB 3 at all times when using XIM + controller. The mouse must remain connected at all times for MAKCU to function with the aimbot. Removing the mouse will stop the cheat from working.
makcu_setup.mouse_conversion_warning_desc: Once the XIM + MAKCU + controller + mouse is setup, the mouse will no longer be functional, due to the conversion of the mouse into controller input.

connection.title: Connecting XIM and MAKCU
connection.final_steps_desc: Once the XIM has been fully setup and MAKCU has been fully setup, proceed to connecting both as shown in the video below.
